bill_title: to make an appropriation for certain higher education grant programs.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for certain higher education grant programs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred twenty-seven thousand six hundred thirty-three dollars ($127,633) and one hundred fifty thousand dollars ($150,000) of federal expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide state student incentive grants to qualified students in universities under the control of the Board of Regents pursuant to chapter 13-55A. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred twenty-seven thousand five hundred dollars ($127,500), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide the tuition equalization grants to qualified students in private colleges pursuant to chapter 13-55B. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated the sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) of federal expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide the necessary expenditure authority for the Robert C. Byrd Honors Scholarship Program. Section 4. There is hereby appropriated the sum of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) of other fund authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide the necessary expenditure authority for the Christa McAuliffe Fellowship Program. Section 5. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 6. Any amount appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 1998, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for certain higher education grant programs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred twenty-seven thousand six hundred thirty-three dollars ($127,633), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide state student incentive grants to qualified students in universities under the control of the Board of Regents pursuant to chapter 13-55A, and one hundred fifty thousand dollars ($150,000) of federal expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide state student incentive grants to qualified students in accredited post-secondary institutions in South Dakota pursuant to chapter 13-55A. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred twenty-seven thousand five hundred dollars ($127,500), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide the tuition equalization grants to qualified students in private colleges pursuant to chapter 13-55B. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated the sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) of federal expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide the necessary expenditure authority for the Robert C. Byrd Honors Scholarship Program. Section 4. There is hereby appropriated the sum of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) of other fund authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide the necessary expenditure authority for the Christa McAuliffe Fellowship Program. Section 5. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 6. Any amount appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 1998, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. BILL HISTORY 1/14/97 First read in House and referred to Appropriations. H.J. 30 1/23/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/23/97 Deferred to another day. H.J. 89 2/18/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/19/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/19/97 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 6, NAYS 3.
